content.body: Is there a particular reason why Array.from (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-cma262/#sec-call) seems to call CloseIterator if an error occurs when setting `A`’s properties, when there are too many items, and when `mapfn` throws an error—but not when IteratorStep results in an abrupt completion nor when the iterator depletes its items?
content.formatted_body: Is there a particular reason why Array.from (https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-cma262/#sec-call) seems to call CloseIterator if an error occurs when setting A’s properties, when there are too many items, and when mapfn throws an error—but not when IteratorStep results in an abrupt completion nor when the iterator depletes its items?
